name: Holiday Inn Salisbury Stonehenge

reviews.text: The hotel is in a good location, if you have a car, to see all the local attractions. The executive room had plenty of room for a family of 4 (2 kids under 5). The hotel was quiet. Our room faced the road, but was very quiet. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The entire hotel was very clean and well maintained.
reviews.title: good location, family-friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like other travelers have mentioned, there are plenty of family-friendly restaurants near by if you do not want to eat at the hotel.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.text: It's the 3rd time I stayed in this hotel. It's right on the motorway so very easy to get to. Close to Stonehenge and Salisbury. It offers a clean bedroom, comfort and a very descent breakfast buffet. Definitely recommend the place for a short stay.
reviews.title: Modern Business Hotel with good access

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The initial booking was easy and efficient. The hotel itself is just off the A303 with easy access from both sides of the dual carriageway, with plenty of parking within easy distance of the hotel entrance. The exterior has a stylish futuristic look all of its own.
reviews.title: Not my typical hotel but I had a great time

reviews.text: The reception was stress-free and competent, with the staff being friendly, professional and able to answer questions easily with knowledge. The entrance has an ambience of its own as does the bar and restaurant area.
reviews.title: A business Trip with a great place to stay

reviews.text: Have stayed on numerous occassions and reguarly get a room upgrade; travelling alone on business. Room service very good, and restaurant ideal for eating alone or as part of a group. A modern and comfortable hotel which has very friendly and welcoming staff.
reviews.title: Ideal location, great flexibility

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This has become our hotel of choice when we visit the Salisbury area. As it's about 10 miles out of town, its not necessarily the most convenient place to stay, but that is more than compensated for the reasonable pricing, ease of car parking and quality and comfort of the rooms.
reviews.title: Excellent modern hotel

reviews.text: On our last visit we were upgraded to a very comfortable executive room which was much larger than the standard rooms and features several additional items (sofa, bathrobes etc). Having said that, the standard rooms are perfectly comfortable with good quality bedding and more
reviews.title: In the middle of nowhere - A Very Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: than adequate sound-proofing.
reviews.title: Functional location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel restaurant is pricey but has some interesting things on the menu such as scallops and prawns with chinese vegetables and pan seared calves liver with pancetta. Mention must also be made of the excellent breakfast which we always have delivered to the room - very good quality and always served hot and on time.
reviews.title: Modern & good location

reviews.text: We have been eating here since it opened, it was my favourite place.NOT ANY MORE, it is being run on a shoe string and you have to keep on for stuff that is missing such a disappointment ...won't be going again such a shame
reviews.title: Used to be great

reviews.text: Booked in a visitor from France - on a special deal - which made the visitor an excellent choice - as its local to us and they thought we had spent a fortune on them. Always worth looking to see if any late deals or special offers when visiting. Lovely room. Our visitor was most impressed.
reviews.title: Great!
A very pleasant surprise
reviews.text: I have stayed at several holiday inns in the UK and have generally found them to be quite satisfactory and reliable but nothing to write a review about. This one is a notch or two above the others and worth a visit. It has a lovely and comfortable lounge area including a working fireplace ( quite nice this month) , a very good restaurant with numerous choices and an unusually helpful staff. The location is great if you are visiting Stonehenge or the surrounding area. There are also pizza and fast food places a short walk away if a sit down restaurant doesn't fit your schedule . The rooms were more typical but clean and satisfactory in every way.

Stayed here with my husband and son. We shared a room, so son had the sofa bed. Staff were extremely efficient and polite. Check in was very quick., Room was very clean. Tea and coffee making facilities in room. Lovely clean towels and a couple of complimentary toiletries.
reviews.title: Good stay.

reviews.text: Plus points were : 1. Clean beds with fresh crisp sheets, 2. Extremely quiet so we slept very well. 3. Bathroom had a great shower and was very clean. 4. Heating & air con worked great.
reviews.title: Holiday Inn Salisbury – Stonehenge which was a fab little stay

reviews.text: Not my first choice, as I managed to foul up my Premier Inn booking. Would stay there again. On arrival, one trainee trying to book a guest in, who was already booked in, but wanted to stay an extra night. Seemed to be taking ages. Another receptionist appeared, and either couldn't or didn't want to to check me in, because I had only booked within the last half an hour, and there was an issue with the the paperwork, which wasn't explained to me??? She passed me on to her trainee colleague, who was still struggling with her guest. Not beyond the realms of possibility for her to check me in??? Didn't feel welcomed by her. No conversation, probably because I wasn't wearing a suit. guest behind me was, he got the full chit-chat and check in, whilst I was still waiting. I am aware that opening doors with key cards isn' the greatest difficulty, but it seemed that I was being hurried when I asked what end goes in the lock. Probably why I ended up with 4 key cards, until an extremely nice receptionist showed me at the door how the cards work. Not the green end in first, as I thought I had been told. Arrows on the cards aren't difficult. Overall it is a very nice hotel, but personally I don't think it is as good value as the Premier Inn, certainly not at £50-£60 per night more. The room I had appeared smaller and the bed softer, but that is a personal opinion. Comfortable yes. Don't know if there was wireless internet, as I couldn't pick a signal up, but there was a cable, which is OK, so long as you have laptop. As I have said I would stay again, but my first choice will be Premier Inn, for value for money & welcoming staff. The night receptionist was night & day different, at least he would chat.
reviews.title: Stuffy Lead Receptionist

reviews.text: We stayed here at the end of March for one night on our way down to Devon along the A303. To be honest, we booked this as we were so put off by the awful reviews of the Travelodges in the area.
reviews.title: Great hotel for families as a stopover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am so pleased that I paid a bit extra for the Holiday Inn; it was definitely worth it! A great sized family room (2 adults, 2 kids) with a large bathroom. The whole place was clean, modern and well presented. Staff were friendly.
reviews.title: Nice overall stay. Good restaurant!!

reviews.text: The hotel is directly off the A303 but with no road noise in our room. At the location, there is also a KFC, Harvester and Pizza Hut, as well as a Co-op shop and BP petrol station. This time, we chose to eat in the hotel; the food was good but I was particularly pleased with the children's menu. Not only did they eat for free (with paying adult) but they had three courses, including a prawn cocktail starter! Even the blackcurrant squash was only 50p!
reviews.title: family stay - happy

reviews.text: Another nice touch was that a kids' movie was included for free on the TV set in the room.
reviews.title: Great Coffee stop

description: Discover the incredibly bold and stylish sophistication of the closest hotel accommodation to the mystical Stonehenge - Holiday Inn Salisbury-Stonehenge. Located on the A303 in the heart of picturesque Wiltshire, England, our contemporary Holiday Inn Salisbury hotel is easily accessible from the M3 motorway, London, the Midlands, and the West Country. Work, relax, and make the most of your stay in the modern, air-conditioned comfort of our well-appointed rooms and suites. Savour mouth-watering cuisine or unwind with casual cocktails in our AA Rosette award winning Solstice Bar & Grill restaurant. Enjoy a STARBUCKS coffee while making use of the free Wi-Fi in our lounge, ideal for informal business meetings or just catching up with friends. Experience easy access to the colourful landscape of sights and attractions dotting the English countryside. Whether you’re traveling for business or on holiday, you’ll enjoy the superb amenities and boutique-style services that set us apart from the usual Salisbury Stonehenge hotels.
